page.title: 06Riber Castle - Matlock Bath
page.content: {Riber Castle,}standing on the crest of a hill 850 feet above sea level dominates the Matlock sky line.It was originally built by John Smedley and has now been turned into a wild-life park which boasts many subsidiary attractions. It is noted for its collection of{lynx some of which have been sent to France to be set free. It is a major centre in this country for the{preservation}of{rare breeds}of cattle,goats,sheep,pigs and poultry. In the past wollabies have been sent to freedom in the Peak District where they still survive.
